00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * This file provides prototypes for the memory management library functions.
00044  * Two different allocators are provided: an arena based allocator that is derived from a
00045  * modified version of ptmalloc2 (used in glibc), and a zone allocator for allocating fixed
00046  * size memory blocks.
00047  *
00048  * <hr>$Revision: 115744 $<hr>
00049  */
00050 
00051 #ifndef __CVMX_MALLOC_H__
00052 #define __CVMX_MALLOC_H__
00053 
00054 #include "cvmx-spinlock.h"
00055 #ifdef __cplusplus
00056 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00057 extern "C" {
00058 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 struct malloc_state;        /* forward declaration */
00062 typedef struct malloc_state *cvmx_arena_list_t;
00063 
00064 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_USER
00065 /**
00066  * Creates an arena from the memory region specified and adds it
00067  * to the supplied arena list.
00068  *
00069  * @param arena_list Pointer to an arena list to add new arena to.
00070  *                   If NULL, new list is created.
00071  * @param ptr        pointer to memory region to create arena from
00072  *
00073  * @param size       Size of memory region available at ptr in bytes.
00074  *
00075  * @return -1 on Failure
00076  *         0 on success
00077  */
00078 int cvmx_add_arena(cvmx_arena_list_t * arena_list, void *ptr, size_t size);
00079 
00080 /**
00081  * allocate buffer from an arena list
00082  *
00083  * @param arena_list arena list to allocate buffer from
00084  * @param size       size of buffer to allocate (in bytes)
00085  *
00086  * @return pointer to buffer or NULL if allocation failed
00087  */
00088 void *cvmx_malloc(cvmx_arena_list_t arena_list, size_t size);
00089 /**
00090  * Allocate zero initialized buffer
00091  *
00092  * @param arena_list arena list to allocate from
00093  * @param n          number of elements
00094  * @param elem_size  size of elementes
00095  *
00096  * @return pointer to (n*elem_size) byte zero initialized buffer or NULL
00097  *         on allocation failure
00098  */
00099 void *cvmx_calloc(cvmx_arena_list_t arena_list, size_t n, size_t elem_size);
00100 /**
00101  * attempt to increase the size of an already allocated buffer
00102  * This function may allocate a new buffer and copy
00103  * the data if current buffer can't be extended.
00104  *
00105  * @param arena_list arena list to allocate from
00106  * @param ptr        pointer to buffer to extend
00107  * @param size       new buffer size
00108  *
00109  * @return pointer to expanded buffer (may differ from ptr)
00110  *         or NULL on failure
00111  */
00112 void *cvmx_realloc(cvmx_arena_list_t arena_list, void *ptr, size_t size);
00113 /**
00114  * allocate a buffer with a specified alignment
00115  *
00116  * @param arena_list arena list to allocate from
00117  * @param alignment  alignment of buffer.  Must be a power of 2
00118  * @param bytes      size of buffer in bytes
00119  *
00120  * @return pointer to buffer on success
00121  *         NULL on failure
00122  */
00123 void *cvmx_memalign(cvmx_arena_list_t arena_list, size_t alignment, size_t bytes);
00124 /**
00125  * free a previously allocated buffer
00126  *
00127  * @param ptr    pointer of buffer to deallocate
00128  */
00129 void cvmx_free(void *ptr);
00130 #endif
00131 
00132 #define CVMX_ZONE_OVERHEAD  (64)
00133 /** Zone allocator definitions
00134  *
00135  */
00136 struct cvmx_zone {
00137     cvmx_spinlock_t lock;
00138     char *baseptr;
00139     char *name;
00140     void *freelist;
00141     uint32_t num_elem;
00142     uint32_t elem_size;
00143     uint32_t align;
00144 };
00145 typedef struct cvmx_zone *cvmx_zone_t;
00146 
00147 static inline uint32_t cvmx_zone_size(cvmx_zone_t zone)
00148 {
00149     return (zone->elem_size);
00150 }
00151 
00152 static inline char *cvmx_zone_name(cvmx_zone_t zone)
00153 {
00154     return (zone->name);
00155 }
00156 
00157 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_USER
00158 /**
00159  * Creates a memory zone for efficient allocation/deallocation of
00160  * fixed size memory blocks from a specified memory region.
00161  *
00162  * @param name      name of zone.
00163  * @param elem_size size of blocks that will be requested from zone
00164  * @param num_elem  number of elements to allocate
00165  * @param mem_ptr   pointer to memory to allocate zone from
00166  * @param mem_size  size of memory region available
00167  *                  (must be at least elem_size * num_elem + CVMX_ZONE_OVERHEAD bytes)
00168  * @param flags     flags for zone.  Currently unused.
00169  *
00170  * @return pointer to zone on success or
00171  *         NULL on failure
00172  */
00173 cvmx_zone_t cvmx_zone_create_from_addr(char *name, uint32_t elem_size, uint32_t num_elem, void *mem_ptr, uint64_t mem_size, uint32_t flags);
00174 /**
00175  * Creates a memory zone for efficient allocation/deallocation of
00176  * fixed size memory blocks from a previously initialized arena list.
00177  *
00178  * @param name       name of zone.
00179  * @param elem_size  size of blocks that will be requested from zone
00180  * @param num_elem   number of elements to allocate
00181  * @param align      alignment of buffers (must be power of 2)
00182  *                   Elements are allocated contiguously, so the buffer size
00183  *                   must be a multiple of the requested alignment for all
00184  *                   buffers to have the requested alignment.
00185  * @param arena_list arena list to allocate memory from
00186  * @param flags      flags for zone.  Currently unused.
00187  *
00188  * @return pointer to zone on success or
00189  *         NULL on failure
00190  */
00191 cvmx_zone_t cvmx_zone_create_from_arena(char *name, uint32_t elem_size, uint32_t num_elem, uint32_t align, cvmx_arena_list_t arena_list, uint32_t flags);
00192 #endif
00193 /**
00194  * Allocate a buffer from a memory zone
00195  *
00196  * @param zone   zone to allocate buffer from
00197  * @param flags  flags (currently unused)
00198  *
00199  * @return pointer to buffer or NULL on failure
00200  */
00201 void *cvmx_zone_alloc(cvmx_zone_t zone, uint32_t flags);
00202 /**
00203  * Free a previously allocated buffer
00204  *
00205  * @param zone   zone that buffer was allocated from
00206  * @param ptr    pointer to buffer to be freed
00207  */
00208 void cvmx_zone_free(cvmx_zone_t zone, void *ptr);
00209 
00210 #ifdef __cplusplus
00211 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00212 }
00213 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00214 #endif
00215 
00216 #endif /* __CVMX_MALLOC_H__ */
